The words ballo and balli have been retained on the advice of the late Irene Alm, whose extensive study of theatrical dance was truncated
by her untimely death (2000).

label: PERSON
context:
Balli could have their own scenery; their music was often divorced
from surviving scores (and is therefore difficult to locate and identify).

label: DATE
context:
By the mid-eighteenth century, ba/li frequently had their own libretti,
could enjoy independent performance, and were more akin to the French ballet than an integral component of opera.
